item.title: Causal Inference Notes
item.description: Causal Inference in Statistics Questions Why is the causal effect identifiable in an IV DAG when the dependencies are linear (from an SCM perspective)? I think this may relate to factor models. Advanced Data Analysis from an Elementary Point of View (Ch. 18-23) Chapter 18 Exercises 18.2. Proof that every path must go through a collider: Observe that every path between two exogenous variables starts with variables going in the opposite direction.
